item.title: The Mermaid Mask launches this summer
item.content:encoded:
• PC

New demo now available.

Tangle Tower successor The Mermaid Mask, formerly The Mermaid’s Tongue, will launch for unspecified consoles and PC via Steam this summer, developer SFB Games announced. A new demo is available now.

“We’ve been working on The Mermaid Mask for a long time—never before have we poured so much love and care into a single project, and it’s become something quite remarkable,” said creative director Adam Vian in a press release. “In 2024, our survival horror game Crow Country became a surprise hit, which diverted our attention a little longer than we’d initially intended (a good problem to have, as Crow Country was wonderfully well received).”

Vian continued, “We can’t wait to finally share The Mermaid Mask with players this year. There really is so much to discover in this game. It’s a great self-contained murder mystery for new players—while at the same time, for those people who are familiar with the series, particularly 2019’s Tangle Tower… you’re really not going to want to miss this.”

Here is an overview of the game, via SFB Games:

A riotous follow-up to the beloved Tangle Tower, one of Apple Arcade‘s top three most highly rated games of all time. It is the latest instalment of SFB Games’ much-loved Detective Grimoire series, which began as a flash game on Newgrounds in 2007. The Mermaid Mask is a witty, visually spectacular detective mystery that balances heavy themes with light-hearted humour.

Submerge yourself in the nautical beauty of the sprawling Mortuga Submarine, unlocking its many oddities and secrets. In the pitch-black waters beyond a long-abandoned fishing town, the enigmatic captain of the world’s strangest submarine has been murdered. Some say he was an immortal time-traveller. Others say he was a vampire, cursed to stay hidden beneath the waves forever.

Interrogate the sub’s suspicious occupants – each lovingly voice-acted and brought to life through expressive, hand-drawn 2D animation – and collect clues by solving satisfying puzzles designed to encourage curiosity, experimentation, and that ultimate “aha!” moment of discovery.

This new entry to the series sees the return of renowned voice actors, Edwyn Tiong (Loco Motive, Harold Halibut, Unavowed) and Amber Lee Connors (Jujustsu Kaizen, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba, DAN DA DAN, The Outer Worlds 2), to their roles as the endearing Detective Grimoire and his sardonic sidekick, Sally. Supported by an incredible cast of voice talent from gaming, anime, film, and radio—to be revealed soon.

item.title: Grasshopper Manufacture to release unannounced title in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

"I feel like we’ll be able to make an announcement soon."

Grasshopper Manufacture plans to release a second, unannounced game in 2026 following ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN, company president Goichi “Suda 51” Suda said in a launch day special “Grasshopper Direct.” 

“We actually have a surprise announcement for you all in this Grasshopper Direct…” Suda said. “It’s ALMOST 100 percent certain that we’ll be releasing one more game during 2026. What kind of game? When can we announce it? We’re not sure just yet… But if you wait a little longer, I feel like we’ll be able to make an announcement soon. Keep checking out various events, media, and videos like this, and sooner or later we’ll have that big announcement ready for you all. Please keep an eye out and look forward to it.”

Suda also answered questions regarding physical and Switch 2 editions of ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN.

“The packaged version everyone is asking about… We call it a ‘physical version’ in the industry. Anyway, lots of people have requested a physical version. We’re currently in talks with several companies trying to get a physical version out, and we’re doing whatever we can to make it happen, so please wait just a bit more for this, too. We’ll announce it as soon as it’s finalized, so we appreciate all your patience. Same goes with the Switch 2 version; we’re doing what we can to make it happen. So again, please give us a little more time.”

ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 11.

item.title: Silent Hill Transmission set for February 12 featuring Silent Hill: Townfall
item.content:encoded:
The Screen Burn Interactive-developed Silent Hill game.

Konami will host a Silent Hill Transmission broadcast on February 12 at 4:00 p.m. PT / 7:00 p.m. ET featuring the latest information on the October 2022-announced Silent Hill: Townfall, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube.

Further information was not announced.

item.title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds ‘Super Monkey Ball Content Drop’ update launches February 11
item.content:encoded:
SEGA will release the “Super Monkey Ball Content Drop” update for Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds on February 11, the company announced (2).

The update will include the following content:

  • AiAi as a playable character
  • Banana Cruiser Vehicle

An in-game “Super Monkey Ball Festival” will also run from February 12 at 4:00 p.m. PT / 7:00 p.m. ET until February 15 at 3:59 pm. PT / 6:59 p.m. ET.

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.
